caseTitle:
Shaukat Ali and another
VS
District Returning Officer and another
tagline: The petitioner was not qualified to contest the election as his academic qualification i.e. Sanad, from a Madrissa not recognized by the University Grants Commission, was not equivalent to Matriculation in accordance with the provisions of section 152(1)(e) of the Punjab Local Government Ordinance, 2001. As regards the question as to whether runner-up can be declared as a successful candidate, it is held that as disqualification was not notorious, therefore, the doctrine of “throw away votes” would not be applicable. The election as a whole of the constituency is declared bad and the Election Commission is directed to conduct fresh election.
